channel.title: BBC News - US & Canada
channel.description: The latest stories from the US & Canada section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Clinton and Sanders clash over Obama
item.description: Democratic candidates Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders clash over their support for the president in their first debate since the New Hampshire primary.

item.title: Man missing 30 years remembers identity
item.description: A Canadian man who suffered a head injury and went missing for 30 years is set to be reunited with his family after remembering his identity.

item.title: Manilow 'doing well' after surgery
item.description: Singer Barry Manilow is out of surgery and "doing well" after being rushed to hospital in Los Angeles.

item.title: Ohio police kill diner machete attacker
item.description: Police in the US state of Ohio shoot and kill a man who attacked four people with a machete in a Mediterranean diner.

item.title: NY officer convicted in stairwell death
item.description: A New York City police officer has been convicted of manslaughter for fatally shooting an unarmed black man in a darkened stairwell.

item.title: Pakistan 'foils plot to free Pearl killer'
item.description: Pakistan's military says it has foiled a plot to free the British-born killer of Wall Street Journal reporter Daniel Pearl from jail.

item.title: Oregon militia stand-off ends
item.description: The remaining armed occupiers of a US wildlife sanctuary in the state of Oregon surrender, ending a tense 41-day stand-off over government control of local land.

item.title: Morgan Stanley to pay $3.2bn settlement
item.description: Morgan Stanley will pay $3.2bn (Â£2.2bn) to US authorities to settle claims that it misled investors about risky mortgage bonds sold before the financial crisis.

item.title: Anxiety hits US and European markets
item.description: The FTSE 100 has fallen 2.4%, with US and European markets also posting sharp declines amid continued anxiety about the state of the global economy.

item.title: US government sues Ferguson on policing
item.description: The US government files a lawsuit against the Missouri town of Ferguson, after it rejects reforms outlined following the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager.

item.title: VIDEO: FBI: Oregon stand-off ends 'peacefully'
item.description: A stand-off at a US wildlife sanctuary in the state of Oregon has ended peacefully, the FBI's agent in charge, Greg Bretzing, has confirmed.

item.title: VIDEO: Cruise passengers on 'terrifying experience'
item.description: Passengers on board a cruise ship battered by a major Atlantic storm off the US east coast, have been speaking about their voyage on the high seas.

item.title: AUDIO: Has Sesame Street been gentrified?
item.description: Sesame Street's Elmo explains why his neighbourhood seems to have gone upmarket.

item.title: VIDEO: WW2 lovebirds' emotional reunion
item.description: A couple who were separated following the Second World War have been reunited after more than 70 years apart.

item.title: VIDEO: Rubio and Christie clash in TV debate
item.description: New Jersey Governor Chris Christie attacks Senator Marco Rubio in the latest TV debate among Republican candidates running for US president.

item.title: VIDEO: The UK and US intelligence relationship
item.description: A look at why the UK and US have a strong intelligence relationship.

item.title: VIDEO: Frozen 'car park' unexpectedly melts
item.description: A frozen lake being used as a car park at the annual Winter Fest event in Wisconsin, US, melts leaving vehicles submerged in the water.

item.title: VIDEO: Car confessions with a Trump and Sanders supporter
item.description: In the run up to the New Hampshire primary, BBC Pop Up is picking up voters to talk about their thoughts on the presidential candidates.

item.title: Obama's 'hopeless' push for gun control
item.description: Barack Obama says the nation will have to address gun control "at some point", but Republicans counter that more government regulation can't stop attacks like the one in Charleston.

item.title: Google defends UK tax arrangements
item.description: Google's UK chief defends the search giant's tax arrangements in a hearing before MPs on the Commons Public Accounts Committee.

item.title: Twitter hit by faltering user growth
item.description: Shares of Twitter fall in after-hours trading as the companies earnings announcement shows growth faltering.

item.title: Canada country profile
item.description: Provides an overview of Canada, including key events and facts about the world's second-largest country

item.title: Puerto Rico profile
item.description: Provides and overview as well as facts and figures for this small dependency of the United States situated in the Caribbean

item.title: St Pierre and Miquelon profile
item.description: Provides an overview of what remains of France's once-extensive possessions in North America

item.title: United States country profile
item.description: Provides an overview of the United States, including key events and facts about this superpower

item.title: What's Hillary Clinton's next move?
item.description: The Democratic nomination has become a real race

item.title: Is there such a thing as a 'black vote?'
item.description: The Democratic voting bloc may not be a lock for Clinton

item.title: Why more Americans are giving up their passports
item.description: Why expats are handing back their passports

item.title: Viewpoint: Are Donald Trump and his rivals a big joke?
item.description: Are Trump and his rivals a big joke, asks PJ O'Rourke

item.title: Hillary Clinton's problem with women
item.description: She has a problem with women and especially younger women.

item.title: Rubio feels the heat in New Hampshire
item.description: Rubio under fire after debate flub

item.title: The chair modelled on a baseball mitt
item.description: The chair designed to fit like a baseball glove

item.title: Why was Beyonce's Super Bowl show significant?
item.description: Beyonce, the Black Panthers and the Super Bowl
